content:
• Thursday, September 5, 2013

  • Nikkei slides as yen firms, Australia modestly lower ahead of elections

    • The Nikkei slips 1.2% in Tokyo as the yen strengthens 0.37% against the dollar to ¥99.74.
    • Elsewhere in the region, Australian shares fall 0.4% ahead of elections this weekend.
    • The Shanghai Composite is +0.2% ahead of CPI and PPI data due Monday.
    • Hang Seng +0.12%, Kospi +0.13%
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 PM
  • ACPW

    Active Power retracts guidance following Chinese fiasco, shares -11.4% AH

    • Active (NASDAQ:ACPW) says it won't hit its Q3 revenue and EPS targets, or its full-year revenue growth, adjusted EBITDA, and net income targets. The company blames weaker-than-expected Chinese sales caused by having a mistaken understanding of a Chinese distribution partnership. (PR)
    • Whereas Active previously announced it had struck a partnership with an IT services firm known as Digital China Information Service Company (a division of a Fortune China 100 firm), it actually struck a deal with Qiyuan Network System Limited, which is unaffiliated with Digital China.
    • CFO Steve Fife: "Our experience this year in China has been very disappointing and for now is unpredictable." Indeed.
    • Q3 results arrive on Oct. 29.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZQK

    More on Quicksilver earnings

    • Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK) posts a mixed FQ3, beating on its EPS but missing on revenue.
    • Net earnings fell 84% as the sports outfitter was hurt by restructuring-related charges, asset write-downs and other items, as well as lower revenue.
    • Revenue decreased 3.3% to $495.8M, led by a 10% drop at its namesake brand.
    • Gross margin fell to 49.4% from 49.5%.
    • Shares +13% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM

  • After-hours top gainers / Losers

    • After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ZQK +13.4%. BLOX +13.2%. OFG +5.9%. AMBA +5.2%. TKR +5.1%.
    • After-hours top losers: NES -14.7%. ICH -8.4%. SWHC -5.0%. DRD -4.6%. BPL -3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone trades up AH on FQ3 beat

    • VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) shares trade up 3.3% AH after the company's FQ3 results beat expectations.
    • Services revenue grew 19% Y/Y in FQ3 to $165.2M, partially offsetting a 28.4% decline in Systems solutions revenue to $250.8M. CEO Richard McGinn: "the acquisition of ENZ ... extends to New Zealand our payment-as-a-service business model that is thriving in the Nordics under Point and launching in other geographies such as the U.S."
    • Management guides for FQ4 revenue of $418M-$422M (consensus of $411.85M), EPS of $0.25 (in-line), and FCF of $25M. It also expects FQ1 of 2014 to "reflect modest sequential improvement to the Q4 guidance."
    •  Conference call scheduled for 4:30pm ET, PR 
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • RALY

    Rally Software Development beats by $0.15, beats on revenue

    • Rally Software Development (NYSE:RALY): Q2 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.15.
    • Revenue of $19.8M beats by $1.83M. Shares +5.39% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • FNSR

    Finisar guidance strong, shares now +4.2% AH

    • Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) expects FQ2 revenue of $277M-$292M and EPS of $0.37-$0.41, soundly above a consensus of $273M and $0.31. Today's gains are tempered a bit by the fact Investors were expecting strong numbers following Finisar's Aug. 6 FQ1 pre-announcement, which led shares to blast higher. Shares also rallied yesterday due to Ciena's numbers.
    • As mentioned in the pre-announcement, datacom component sales were strong in FQ1, rising 12.5% Q/Q and 32% Y/Y to $184.4M. Telecom components +2.7% Q/Q and +1% Y/Y to $81.7M.
    • Gross margin rose 290 bps Q/Q and 480 bps Y/Y to 35.1%, thanks to 20% Y/Y rev. growth and a favorable mix. That, along with the fact opex only rose 11% Y/Y, led op. margin to jump to 12.2% from 8.2% in FQ4 and 5.4% a year ago.
    • Finisar says demand for its 100G components (previous) and wavelength selective switch products (WSS) remains strong; the company is the market leader in the latter space.
    • CC at 5PM ET. FQ1 results, PR, presentation
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • KFY

    Korn/Ferry beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Korn/Ferry (NYSE:KFY): FQ1 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $237.6M beats by $12.6M. Shares +1.55% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella jumps AH after Q2 beat

    • Shares of Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) jump up 5.8% AH after the company's Q2 results beat expectations.
    • Gross margin contracted to 61.8% in Q2 from 69.1% in Q2 last year.
    • Opex grew 20.8% Y/Y to $16.4M.
    • Conference call scheduled for 5pm ET, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • SEAC

    SeaChange beats by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • SeaChange (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q2 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $37.4M misses by $0.95M. Shares -3.67% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • COO

    Cooper Cos beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Cooper Cos (NYSE:COO): FQ3 EPS of $1.74 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $412M (+9% Y/Y) beats by $1.46M. Shares -0.26% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez misses by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q2 EPS of $0.16 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $157.9M (+16.9% Y/Y) beats by $0.09M. Shares -5.10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • BLOX

    Infoblox beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Infoblox (NYSE:BLOX): FQ4 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $63.1M (+40% Y/Y) beats by $3.88M. Shares +12.94% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • ZQK

    Quiksilver beats by $0.06, misses on revenue

    • Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ3 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $496M misses by $9.02M. Shares +14.04% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • TKR

    Timken announces plans to separate its businesses into to separately traded public companies

    • Timken (NYSE:TKR) announces plans to separate its steel business from its bearings and power transmission business through a spinoff, creating two publicly traded companies
    • The spinoff is expected to be completed within 12 months.
    • Ward J. Timken, Jr. will serve as chairman and CEO of the new steel company with estimated annual revenue of approximately $1.7B.
    • Richard G. Kyle will become president and CEO of the global bearings and power transmission business, with estimated annual revenue of approximately $3.4B.
    • Shares +6.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA): Q2 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $37.7M (+35% Y/Y) beats by $1.71M. Shares +5.54% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • FNSR

    Finisar EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR): FQ1 EPS of $0.31 in-line.
    • Revenue of $266.07M beats by $2.92M. Shares +1.93% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Smith & Wesson (SWHC): FQ1 EPS of $0.40beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $171.0M (+25.8% Y/Y) beats by $5.98M. Shares -4.18% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 8 Comments
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific finishes higher after saying its Allair Bronchial Thermoplasty system gets a postitive mention in a key medical journal

    • Boston Scientific (BSX +5.9%) finishes the day near 4-year highs after it announced yesterday that The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology featured data related to its Alair Bronchial Thermopasty System.
    • The data was from the Asthma Intervention Research 2 clinical trial examining the safety and effectiveness of the Alair System, which is based on a post-approval study of BT-treated patients from the AIR2 Trial who were followed for a total of five years.
    • Key findings reported at five years following BT include a reduction in the percentage of BT-treated patients experiencing severe exacerbations and fewer emergency room visits recorded for respiratory symptoms in BT-treated patients compared to the year prior to receiving BT.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone beats by $0.04 , beats on revenue

    • VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ3 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $418M beats by $17.17M. Shares +2.36% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy cancels analyst day meeting, shares rise

    • Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.8%) shares have risen steadily since midday after reports said the company had cancelled its analyst day meeting.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • DGLY

    On-officer camera enthusiasm propels Digital Ally

    • Shares of Digital Ally (DGLY +22.3%) take off as the hype surrounding TASER's (TASR -0.7%) AXON on-officer cameras spills over.
    • Hat tip to SA contributor super-trades, who identified the opportunity in Digital Ally on Aug. 30, outlining the company's strong growth potential and intellectual property position.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Libra development could cause Petrobras more harm than good, UBS says

    • Petrobras (PBR +6.2%) risks losing shareholder value from developing Brazil’s Libra oilfield as high costs and taxes erode returns, UBS says.
    • PBR may lose as much as $0.64/share (1.5 real/share) from Libra, according to UBS: “Our concerns on Libra are mainly twofold: expected low returns and low profitability visibility, and high signing bonus payment to be disbursed upfront which will stress Petrobras’ already tight balance sheet."
    • UBS expects it to take PBR and its partners until 2021 to start selling crude from Libra, about two years longer than current estimates, as higher than expected levels of natural gas at the field will increase extraction costs and require more equipment.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy credit rating cut another notch at S&P

    • Walter Energy (WLT +7.5%) is downgraded further into junk territory, to B- from B, with a negative outlook, by Standard & Poor's, which believes the met coal producer's leverage will remain high as it continues to face low coal prices.
    • S&P says market conditions will remaining challenging for WLT over the next year, noting coal prices likely will remain weak amid lower demand in Europe, slowing economic activity in China and a lack of operating disruptions among competitors.
    • Meanwhile, Cowen reiterates its Outperform rating on WLT after meeting with top management; the firm comes away positive on cost control at WLT's mines and expects a successful conclusion to the planned asset sale/JV process (Briefing.com).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 13 Comments
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharmaceuticals prices its $8.8M share offering at $1.72, an 11% discount to yesterday's close

    • Catalyst Pharmaceutical (CPRX -4.1%) slips after pricing its 8.8M share registered dirct offering at $1.72, an 11% discount to Wednesday's close.
    • The offering appears to be a sound move to raise funds, considering stock has more than doubled over the past three months. Gross proceeds from the deal should come to about $15.1M.
    • It plans to use the net proceeds primarily to fund costs associated with its product development efforts for Firdapse.
    • Firdapse is being evaluated for the symptomatic treatment of patients with Lambert-Eaton Myasthenic Syndrome.
    • The company has a remaining float of around 41.5M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • HXSCL

    Micron, SanDisk rally on new Hynix fire reports, surging memory prices

    • Countering comments made by SK Hynix (OTC:HXSCL) yesterday, Wedge Partners says the fire that broke out at Hynix's Chinese memory fab will cause at least a 2-month production delay, and that Hynix has suspended price negotiations with clients.
    • The remarks come as DRAM spot prices jump 20% on account of the fire, and reports emerge several top memory manufacturers have joined Hynix in putting shipments on hold.
    • There could be major downstream ramifications: TrendForce thinks 11M notebook shipments and 10M smartphone shipments will be affected within a month if "main production procedures are halted." The firm estimates it will take 6 months for all of the damage to be fixed.
    • Prior to the fire, DRAM and NAND prices had been slumping this summer after rallying earlier this year.
    • Micron (MU +3%) and SanDisk (SNDK +1.9%) are adding to yesterday's gains. DRAM/NAND giant Samsung (OTC:SSNLF, OTC:SSNGY) rose 1.9% overnight in Seoul, while Hynix fell 1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • OAS

    Oasis Petroleum +5% on Williston deal, but company no longer takeover bait

    • Investors cheer Oasis Petroleum's (OAS +5.1%) move to snatch up 161K acres' worth of North Dakota oil fields, including 136K acres from Zenergy, one of the last remaining closely held energy producers in the state’s Williston Basin.
    • “As some have been concerned about the company stepping outside the basin to bolster inventory, this announcement could cause... a sigh of relief,” SunTrust analysts write.
    • But the deal could disappoint those who saw OAS as takeover bait; the acquisitions, which boost the size of the company’s North Dakota drilling acreage by nearly 50%, make it a much larger bite to swallow.
    • Emerald Oil (EOX +4.2%) and Triangle Petroleum (TPLM +3.2%) also are up sharply, attributed to the OAS Williston Basin news.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • KTOS

    Kratos unit awarded new contract to upgrade Eutelstat's geolocation systems; Jefferies raises price target

    • Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (KTOS +4.8%) says its SAT Corporation subsidiary has received an order from Eutelsat to upgrade multiple satID geolocation systems.
    • Eutelsat also purchased software maintenance and technical support for satID over the next 5 years.
    • Separately, Jefferies raises its price target on the shares from $7.10 to $9.70, citing a possible debt refinancing on January 1st and a backlog of potential awards that may materialize next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • CREX

    Ronin Wireless wins digital marketing order from Indian Motorcycle

    • Shares of Ronin Wireless (RNIN +10.3%) spike after the company wins an order from Indian Motorcycle to supply hardware, software, content engineering, and support for a digital marketing initiative across Indian's dealer network.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • MNK

    Mallinckrodt says its acute pain drug met primary endpoints in Phase III testing

    • Mallinckrodt (MNK +2.3%) trades up after saying its investigational drug MNK-795 showed statistically significant improvement in pain scores compared to a placebo during Phase III testing for treatment of acute pain following bunion removals.
    • The drug's New Drug Application was accepted by the FDA in July and granted priority review.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • CUR

    Neuralstem announces a $4M registered direct placement

    • Neuralstem (CUR +3.1%) says it's entered into agreements with certain accredited investors for a registered direct placement of 2,535,000 shares of common stock at a price of $1.60 per share.
    • Aggregate proceeds from the offering total around $4,056,000.
    • The offering is expected to close on or about September 9.
    • T.R. Winston acted as the exclusive placement agent for the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • JOSB

    Heard during Jos. A Banks Clothiers' earnings call

    • Jos. A Bank Clothiers (JOSB +6.7%) notes its product mix hasn't been spot-on as the suit business stays in a cyclical pattern. The company believes it can improve its assortment strategy.
    • Q3 is off to a good start with total sales, comparable store sales, and direct sale all showing a Y/Y increase for the first four weeks of the quarter.
    • Execs say the company will continue to pursue the right strategic acquisition.
    • webcast
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • KTOS

    Kratos expands gains after Jefferies hikes PT

    • Kratos Defense & Security (KTOS +5%) shares are expanding gains from the morning after Jefferies hikes its PT to $9.70 from $7.10. The firm maintains a Hold rating.
    • Although Jefferies keeps its FY2013 EPS estimate of -$0.30 (consensus of -$0.32), the firm revises its FY2014 estimate to $0.30 from $0.10 (consensus of $0.07) based on the assumption of a debt refinancing and a slight bump in its revenue forecast "given the backlog of potential awards that may materialize next year."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • MRK

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals prices its $700M senior note offering

    • Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST +2.1%) gains after pricing an increased offering of $700M in senior convertible notes.
    • The 2018 offering bears interest at 1.125% a year and the 2020 notes to pay 1.875% a year.
    • The notes will be convertible at approximately $82.43 per share, representing a premium of around 32.5% to Thursday's closing price.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice continues to plummet following FQ1 results

    • Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD -16.5%) shares continue to plummet after the company released FQ1 results yesterday.
    • On the conference call, the company issued FQ2 guidance for revenue of $44.75M-$45.25M (consensus of $45.25M) and EPS of -$0.06 to -$0.08 (-0.07).
    • Full year guidance is for revenue of $184M-$187M (consensus of $186.01M) and EPS of -$0.23 to -$0.27 (-$0.26).
    • CEO Stephen Collins: "Nothing has changed in our disposition" regarding the DoJ's litigation of Bazaarvoice's PowerReviews acquisition. But "[l]itigation is unpredictable." The trial is scheduled to begin Sept. 23 and will take approximately 3 weeks.
    • BV had run up 42.7% through yesterday since plummeting on news that the DoJ wanted to undo the company's acquisition of PowerReviews back in Jan.
     
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • PH

    Parker Hannifin initiated at Morgan Stanley with an Underweight; stock higher despite the cautious outlook

    • Parker-Hannifin (PH +1%) trades higher today, thumbing its nose at Morgan Stanley's less-than-enthusiastic initiation of coverage with Underweight and $92 price target.
    • The firm calls PH the purest play on global IP growth to be found in the Machinery group, but the stock's bull thesis center's on a stronger pickup in core growth in FY14, fueled by Machinery OEM/ dealer inventory restocking.
    • Morgan believes that the company's FY year end timing makes it more likely to be a FY15 event.
    • Currently, the stock trades at a rich 27% premium to its Machinery group and well above its 6% cross-cycle premium, so the "probability of the Bull Case playing out is low.”
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • TSLA

    Sell-side continues to gush over solar; shares rally again

    • A day after JPMorgan provided a big lift to Chinese solar stocks, Deutsche is giving a boost to both Chinese and U.S. names.
    • Analyst Vishal Shah predicts U.S. solar installation growth will total 6GW-8GW in the 2013-2014 timeframe, and that the market could see "an inflection point" in 2015 ahead of a 2016 tax credit expiration.
    • He expects the adoption of new incorporation and leasing structures - a SolarCity (SCTY +4.4%) specialty - to boost growth by lowering financing costs, and views the potential arrival of residential leasing options as another major growth catalyst. In spite of ITC anti-dumping tariffs, Chinese firms are expected to gain share.
    • In addition to SolarCity, winners include First Solar (FSLR +4.9%), Canadian Solar (CSIQ +5.1%), Daqo (DQ +11.9%), Suntech (STP +14%), Trina (TSL +4%), Yingli (YGE +5.6%), SunEdison (SUNE +2.4%), and ReneSola (SOL +2.5%). ETFs are also up: TAN +3%. KWT +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining tumbles after Barclays downgrade

    • Newmont Mining (NEM -3.3%) is downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight at Barclays, as the firm cuts its North American precious metal mining industry (NYSEARCA:GDX) rating to Neutral from Positive to reflect its gold forecast changes and the recent rally in miners.
    • Goldcorp (GG -2.4%) remains Top Pick as Barclays continues to favor quality names that offer production growth, cost control and balance sheet strength.
    • Following relative share price outperformance YTD, the firm looks to 2014 metrics in downgrading NEM.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy eyes refinancing, shares rise

    • Peabody Energy (BTU +3.2%) powers higher after reports yesterday that it is seeking to refinance some of its $6.3B in debt.
    • Citigroup is said to be arranging the financing for a $1.2B term loan and has set a meeting with lenders Friday; such term B financing is mainly sold to non-bank lenders such as hedge funds, bank loan mutual funds or collaterized loan obligations.
    • BTU had $862.5M in debt due in Oct. 2016 and ~$301.8M in loans that mature in June 2015; the loans pay interest at 2.0-2.25 percentage points more than Libor.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • HDB

    Financials lead rally in India as Rajan impresses

    • For a second straight day, Indian stocks rise sharply — Sensex +2.2% — with banks leading the way, as new RBI governor Raghuram Rajan has apparently managed to instill some confidence in the market. (previous)
    • In addition to the creation of inflation indexed savings certificates and the issuance of long-awaited new banking licenses, Rajan will open FX swap lines between banks and the RBI (see diagram) a move BofA says may boost the country's flagging reserves by $10B.
    • "This is exactly what the market wanted to hear," one Mumbai-based banker says. Apparently so — shares of India's largest lender HDFC Bank (HDB +7.1%) rose 8% Thursday, fueling what Bloomberg says was the largest rally in the S&P BSE India Bankex index in four years.
    • The WisdomTree India Earnings Fund (EPI +1.8%), ICICI Bank (IBN +12.3%), The WisdomTree Indian Rupee Fund (ICN +0.3%).
    • Other ETFs: INDY, EPI, PIN, INP, INDA, INXX, SCIF, SCIN, INDL, SMIN, INR.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM

  • Midday top 10 gainers / Losers

    • Midday top 10 gainers: BYFC +43%. OTC:PGRX +28%. ENVI +25%. LOCM +23%. KDN +22%. OTC:MDXG +21%. SINO +19%. RMTI +16%. ZIPR +16%. PBIB +13%.
    • Midday top 10 Losers: AGEN -29%. BV-OLD -16%. MIND -12%. DSS -11%. CONN -10%. KIOR -7%. SR-OLD -8%. OTC:IGC -9%. DDE -8%. GPL -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • NDZ

    Nordion gains on a solid FQ4 earnings beat

    • Nordion (NDZ +1.8%) gains after posting a solid FQ4 earnings beat this morning.
    • Net profit surged, thanks to the sale of one of its business units. In July the company sold its targeted-therapies unit to BTG PLC for $190M, resulting in a gain of about $182M.
    • Total revenue grew by 6.8% Y/Y, while gross margin was flat at 55%.
    • Medical-isotopes segment sales +9% Y/Y.
    • Sterilization-technologies sales +14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • GNK

    Dry bulkers rise again, Global Hunter says market has turned corner

    • Dry bulk names are catching a bid again today after putting in a strong session Wednesday.
    • "The dry bulk market appears to be turning a corner with supply and demand finally matching up more closely following several years of heavy supply," Global Hunter said yesterday. (full note)
    • Across the sector: GNK +8.7%, EGLE +8%, BALT +6.7%, DSX +2.9%, SBLK +6%, DRYS +9.2%, SB +3%, NM +4.6%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • UFPI

    DA Davidson ups Universal Forest Products to Buy

    • Universal Forest Products (UFPI +1.6%) gets a lift on an upgrade to Buy, at D.A. Davidson.
    • Davidson says the stock is weak due to concerns about a slowdown in the housing recovery, but thos fears are overblown.
    • The firm says that UFPI's exposure to residential construction is less than 20% of total revenues.
    • The shares now 24% below its $46 price target, making the current valuation very attractive.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • LPX

    Louisiana-Pacific climbs on Ainsworth acquisition, upgrades

    • Louisiana-Pacific (LPX +10.7%) shares climb as investors absorb the company's $1.1B acquisition of Ainsworth Lumber. CEO Curt Stevens characterized the move as a play on the U.S. housing recovery and a chance to gain exposure to Asian markets.
    • Following the announcement, Deutsche upgraded LPX to Buy with a PT of $21 ($20 previous): "In a segment legendary for aggressive & destructive 'herd behavior,' consolidation places latent capacity in a smaller number of hands and reduces the risk of too many players restarting too much capacity too quickly ... On its own, this deal looks attractive: ANS has the best margins among peers."
    • DA Davidson also upgraded the company to Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • POZN

    Pozen soars on Sanofi deal

    • Shares of Pozen (POZN +11.3%) post double-digit gains.
    • The company announced a partnership with Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) yesterday for the commercialization of PA8140 and PA32540 (safer aspirin).
    • SA contributor and Zacks analyst Jason Napodano sees PA as a "$500M product worldwide" and based on the disclosed terms of the deal, Napodano says the shares may be worth $9 each.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • FAST

    Fastenal August sales growth up 7.2%

    • Fastenal (FAST +4.8%) moves up after posting solid August sales numbers. Net sales rose 2.5% year over year to $297M, up from $290M in the same month of 2012.
    • Daily sales were $13M, up 7.2% from $12.6M in 2012.
    • Manufacturing customers grew 6.1% Non-residential construction customers grew 7.3%.
    • The change in currencies in foreign countries, primarily Canada, reduced daily sales growth rate by 0.3% during the month.
    • Barron's points out the strong numbers, noting that Wunderlich feels the numbers indicate growing demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries -12% after swinging to Q2 loss

    • Mitcham Industries (MIND -12.2%) slumps to three-month lows after posting a Q2 loss as equipment leasing revenue declined for the fourth straight quarter.
    • Soft Q2 results were expected due to seasonal patterns in the leasing business, but "the level of leasing revenues was clearly disappointing," CEO Bill Mitcham said, citing continued weakness in U.S. land activity, project delays due to permitting difficulties, and labor unrest and security issues in Colombia.
    • Revenue in the equipment leasing segment fell 41% to $6.4M; gross margin fell to 20.6% from 32.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • AGEN

    Agenus loses nearly a third of its value on GSK vaccine results

    • Shares of Agenus (AGEN -31.5%) collapse after GlaxoSmithKline (GSK -0.9%) says the MAGE A-3 cancer vaccine missed one of its primary endpoints in a Phase 3 melanoma trial.
    • MAGE A-3 uses AGEN's QS-21 as an adjuvant.
    • Shareholders will now look to MAGRIT data (the non-small cell lung cancer trial for MAGE-A3) due in H1 2014. (PR)
    • More on the results

  • DATA

    Tableau partners with Syncsort

    • Tableau Software (DATA +3.5%) shares trade up after the company partners with data integration services provider Syncsort. The partnership is geared to provide mutual customers with a streamlined way to push data to Hadoop and visualize it through business analytics software.
    • The venture may broaden Tableau's adoption - Syncsort has over 12K deployments and 90 of the Fortune 100's companies are customers.

  • VTNR

    Vertex Energy lifts guidance after project completion

    • Vertex Energy (VTNR +4.5%) issues upside guidance for Q3, seeing revenues of $45M-$50M vs. $37M analyst consensus, after announcing completion of the largest diesel project in its history.
    • VTNR says Vertex Recovery removed and sold 2M gallons of distressed fuel in Q3, and participated in the dismantling of a fuel system and the decommissioning of a facility; it anticipates similar projects will be an increasing part of its business going forward.

  • HIMX

    Analyst note sends Himax flying for second day in a row

    • A day after a bullish Craig-Hallum note gave a huge boost to Himax (HIMX +7.9%) shares, an upbeat Oppenheimer note is doing the same. The firm has raised its PT to $12 from $9, and (echoing Craig-Hallum) says the outlook for Himax's LCOS microdisplay business is better than previously expected.
    • Though Google Glass grabs most of the headlines, Himax mentioned on its Q2 CC its LCOS microdisplays are being "applied by numerous customers and partners to create products targeting a wide range of applications." Examples cited include automotive heads-up displays and handheld (pico) projectors.
    • Shares +22% from Tuesday's close.

  • Indonesia weak again, Malaysia keeps rates on hold

    • The market "spooked because of the rupiah," one trader in Jakarta says, explaining late selling pressure that sent Indonesian shares (IDX, EIDO) lower by 0.55%. The currency remains under pressure amid Fed and Syria jitters. Indonesia SmallCap ETF: IDXJ
    • Elsewhere, Malaysia's central bank keeps its overnight policy rate on hold (3%) as expected, noting that likely upward pressure on prices will be "from a low level and will be mitigated" by a number of factors. The bank also notes that in the Malaysian economy, "domestic demand has continued to support growth amid the weaknesses in external demand." (PR) Last month, data showed the country avoided slipping into a deficit in Q2. KLCI (EWM) +0.25%.
    • Across the region: SET (THD, TTF, TF) +0.8%, Ho Chi Minh (VNM) +1.3%, Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM

  • FCEL

    FuelCell surges premarket after strong FQ3 results

    • FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) +14.6% premarket after reporting better than expected revenue growth and improved margins in its FQ3 results.
    • Product sales, which comprise ~85% of revenue, more than doubled to $45.4M.
    • Gross margin improved to +8.4% from -9.2%, driven by improved overhead cost absorption from higher production levels and a sales mix that includes power plants along with fuel cell kits.
    • FCEL also announced a marketing agreement with NRG Energy (NYSE:NRG), adding a new sales channel for the marketing and sales of its power plants.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • KDN

    Sweden's SKF to buy Kaydon in $1.25B deal

    • Sweden's SKF, the world's biggest bearings maker, agrees to acquire Kaydon Corp. (NYSE:KDN) in an all-cash deal valued at ~$1.25B.
    • SKF (OTCPK:SKFRY) has said it wants to expand in North America as industrial growth and modest wage increases make the region more attractive for major investments this year than China; KDN generates 62% of its sales ($475M total in 2012) in North America.
    • The offer of $35.50/share represents a 22% premium over yesterday's closing price.
    • KDN +22.5% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 AM
